but was able to breastfeed.  develops on the kidneys,

This 51-year-old patient is a
special case with only one kidney,
but Mr.  Not only did he have stage five kidney failure,
but he also had a kidney
cell cancer that developed, so instead of
removing the entire kidney to treat cancer,
doctors chose the
more difficult method of removing a portion of the kidney.
There is no way back for the kidney, which means we have to
keep the kidney at all costs. We have to
control the blood vessels well with the
indication of removing part of the kidney to still ensure
that the surface is oncological.
Maintain the patient's level of kidney failure
and the patient's quality of life
without further deterioration. Finally, the surgical
technique used during tumor resection
is to not clamp the renal pedicle after about 2:30
minutes of laparoscopic surgery.  The
patient recovered quite quickly and was discharged from the
hospital. People with only one kidney
can still live their entire lives like normal people.

in this survey with the ability to
work day and night and perform work
more accurately than humans. Robots are being seen
as effective tools to eliminate
pathogens in flower fields.  In the Netherlands,
this is the robot Ti, which is carefully going through the
flower beds to check each flower.
If it detects flowers with pathogens,
it will immediately remove them to prevent it from
spreading to healthy flowers.
AI technology and the ability to
accurately determine the location play an important role in
helping the robot find the flowers that need to be
eliminated. We feed information about tulips
from farmers into this robot with three
cameras at the front.  The three angles of the images taken
with the GPS antenna on the machine head will help
determine the exact coordinates of the diseased flower.
This coordinate will be remembered until the robot
passes by and we will activate it so that the needle
injects the medicine accurately.  The
price of a robot with
high skills and efficiency is nearly 3.2 billion VND
during the peak season when warmer weather
increases the risk of disease on flowers.
The Netherlands has deployed 45 robots
in the field.  across the country to ensure the ability to
cope with the epidemic.

March 19. The International Olympic Committee
IOC announced the human athletes
Russia and Belarus will not participate in the
parade of athletes taking place
at the opening ceremony
of the Paris Olympics this July. The opening ceremony of the Paris Olympics on
July 26 will not be held in the
stadium but on  Lotus River
in front of about 300,000 spectators,
these athletes will still be able to participate in
other parts of the Opening Ceremony, but will only
stand outside the parade of the
athletes' delegations at the 2024 Paris Olympics,
Russian and Belarusian athletes.  will compete

illegal immigrants crossing the border. The
N Circuit Court of Appeals will hold debates
